Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sergio Lee Pedroza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sergio Lee Pedroza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sergio Lee Pedroza was found guilty of Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Sergio Lee Pedroza was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sergio Lee Pedroza

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sergio Lee Pedroza in court.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Sergio Lee Pedroza.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea. 
Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS T COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 4 days served. 

AS T COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 4 days served. 

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 60 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review, as to count 2.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Complete 35 hours of community service.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Drivers license suspension for 6 months, as to count 3.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 11/3/22.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 29.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Jury Instructions 2150

Plea Agreement

Defendant Sergio Lee Pedroza appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Moran for Michael G. Levine appeared by video for Sergio Lee Pedroza.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Milwaukee police officer Nathan Grap. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders  balance to be returned.  
  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plea not guilty to count 3, DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
